newsitem.title: BULGARIA: SOFIA MUSIC WEEKS MAY 23-JUNE 30 PROGRAMME.
newsitem.headline: SOFIA MUSIC WEEKS MAY 23-JUNE 30 PROGRAMME.

text.p: Bulgaria's Sofia Music Weeks festival this year will feature an open air performance of Giuseppe Verdi's Aida on the Alexander Batemberg square in central Sofia on June 27, 28 and 29, festival officials said.
The performance, featuring bass Nikola Gyuzelev, will include the communist era white marble mausoleum in the stage scenery, director Plamen Kartalov told a news conference.
The programme of the May 23-June 30 festival follows:

MAY 23, 1900 hrs. Sofia Opera, Bulgaria Hall, Official opening of the Sofia Music Weeks, Sofia Philharmonic orchestra: Conductor - Emil Tabakov, Soloist - Rosa Mihailova - soprano, Programme: Pancho Vladigerov's Vardar Rhapsody, Richard Wagner - Fragments from Tristan and Isolde and Tannhauser.
MAY 26(JUNE 2), 1900 hrs. Sofia National Palace of Culture (NDK) Hall 12; Johann Sebastian Bach six suites for solo violoncello BWV 1007, 1012, Cellist - Ventseslav Nikolov
MAY 27, 1900 hrs. Sofia Opera, Bulgaria Hall, Piano recital of Alexander Hinchev, Programme: Scarlatti - Five sonatas, Chopin - Four mazurkas, Three waltzes.
MAY 28, 1900 hrs. Sofia National Palace of Culture (NDK) Hall 6, Bulgarian Capella Choir Svetoslav Obretenov; Conductor Georgi Robev, Renaissance music.
MAY 28, 1800 hrs. Sofia Opera, Ballet Gala Concert

MAY 29, 1900 hrs. Sofia Opera, Bulgaria Hall, Sofia Philharmonic Orchestra; Conductor - Emil Tabakov, Soloists - Vesselin Parashkevov - violin, Yang Chang Cho - cello, Variations on Haydn's Violin and violoncello concert, Symphony No. 1.

JUNE 4, 1900 hrs. Sofia National Palace of Culture (NDK) Hall 9, Academic Brass Quintet; Georgi Spasov - flute, Georgi Zhelyazov - oboe, Petko Radev - clarinet, Marin Valchanov - bassoon, Vladislav Grigorov horn, Programme: G. Onslov, E. Botsa, B. Hoklamb.
JUNE 5, 1900 hrs. Sofia Opera, Bulgaria Hall, Piano recital Milena Mollova; Programme Schubert, Schumann, Liszt.
JUNE 6, 1900 hrs. Sofia Opera, Bulgaria Hall, Sofia Capella Choir Madrigals, Conductor - Stoyan Kralev.
JUNE 6, 1800 hrs. Sofia Opera, Mozart's The Marriage of Figaro, Conductor - Michail Damev, Scene Director - Plamen Kartalov.
JUNE 7, 1600 hrs. Sofia Opera, Puccini's Turandot, Conductor - Boris Hinchev, Scene Director - Plamen Kartalov.
JUNE 8, 1600 hrs. Sofia Opera, Sofia Opera Ballet, Zorba the Greek.
JUNE 9, 1900 hrs. Sofia National Palace of Culture (NDK) Hall 9, Salon of the arts, Dilyana Momchilova - cello, Lora Chekoratova - piano, Programme: Bach, Brahms, Mendelssohn, Shostakovich.
JUNE 10, 1900 hrs. Sofia National Palace of Culture (NDK) Hall 2, Bulgarian National Radio Choir, Conductor - Roumen Raichev, Soloist - Teodosi Spasov - Kaval; Programme: Shchedrin.
JUNE 11, 1900 hrs. Sofia Opera, Bulgaria Hall, Capella Choir Sofia Soloists, Conductor - Plamen Dzhurov, Programme: Mendelssohn's Laudate pueri, Poulenc, Haydn, Schubert.
JUNE 12, 1800 hrs. Sofia Stefan Makedonski Music Theatre; Kalman's Queen of Chardash, Conductor - Rouslan Raichev, Scene Director Nikolai Nikolaev.
JUNE 13, 1800 hrs. Sofia National Palace of Culture (NDK) Hall 1, Sofia Opera Ballet, Tchaikovsky's Swan Lake.

JUNE 15, 1900 hrs. Sofia Opera, Bulgaria Hall, Bulgarian National Radio Symphonic Orchestra, Conductor - Milen Nachev Soloist Angel Stankov - violin, Programme: V. Stoyanov's Feast ouverture, Al. Yosifov's Concert for violin and orchestra No.2, Igor Stravinsky's Rite of Spring.
JUNE 19, 1900 hrs. Sofia Opera, Bulgaria Hall, Salon of the arts, Michail Homitser - cello, Ruzhka Charakchieva - piano, Programme: Boccherini, Beethoven, Franck.
JUNE 22, 1900 hrs. Sofia Opera, Bulgaria Hall, Sofia String Quartet; Lyubomir Nenchev - violin, Ognyan Konstantinov - viola, Hristo Tanev - cello, Programme: Schubert, Dvorak, Shostakovich.
JUNE 26, 1900 hrs. Sofia National Palace of Culture (NDK) Hall 1, Bulgarian National Radio Choir, Soloist - Michail Homitser - cello, Programme: Brahms, Dvorak.

JUNE 27/28/29 21 hrs. Sofia Alexander Batemberg square, Giuseppe Verdi's Aida, Conductor - Georgi Notev, Scene Director - Plamen Kartalov, Soloists: Nikola Gyuzelev, Roumen Doikov, Maria Belcheva, Stefka Mineva, Stoyan Popov, Petar Bakardzhiev, Svetlozar Rangelov, Tzvetan Tzvetkov.
JUNE 30, 1900 hrs. Sofia Opera, Bulgaria Hall, British duo Convivium - Elizabeth Walfish - violin, Paul Nicholson - piano, Programme: Schubert, Bach.
JUNE 30, 1900 hrs. Sofia National Palace of Culture (NDK) Hall 1, Folk concert, folk troupes Trakia, Pirin, Filip Koutev.
